[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [DoS] [Memory exhaustion] Can an attacker submit many large PatchUpsertJWK patches in a governance proposal to exhaust validator memory? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [DoS] [CPU exhaustion] Can complex JWKMoveStruct variants in PatchUpsertJWK cause excessive CPU usage during variant unpacking? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Side channel] [Timing attack] Can timing differences in PatchUpsertJWK processing reveal information about the current JWK set? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Side channel] [Memory access patterns] Can memory access patterns during PatchUpsertJWK deserialization leak information through cache timing? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Side channel] [Error messages] Do error messages from failed PatchUpsertJWK processing leak sensitive information about the JWK state? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Standards] [JWK RFC compliance] Does PatchUpsertJWK enforce RFC 7517 compliance for JWK structure, or can non-compliant keys be injected? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Standards] [OIDC compliance] Do issuer strings in PatchUpsertJWK follow OIDC issuer identifier rules, or can invalid issuers be registered? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Standards] [URL validation] If issuer is supposed to be a URL, is it validated as such, or can arbitrary strings be used? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Deserialization gadgets] Can PatchUpsertJWK be used as a deserialization gadget in a gadget chain attack against the Move VM? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Type confusion via Any] Can the MoveAny abstraction in PatchJWKMoveStruct be exploited to achieve arbitrary type confusion in the Move VM? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Cross-contract exploitation] Can a malicious smart contract abuse PatchUpsertJWK types to exploit the JWK system from user space? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Reflection attacks] Can Move's type reflection capabilities be abused to inspect PatchUpsertJWK internals and craft exploits? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Serialization bomb] Can a crafted PatchUpsertJWK act as a compression bomb, expanding to massive size during deserialization? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Hash collision] Can two different PatchUpsertJWK instances produce the same hash, causing deduplication failures? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Replay attack] Can old PatchUpsertJWK patches be replayed after they've been removed to restore compromised keys? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [State explosion] Can an attacker use PatchUpsertJWK to create exponential state growth by repeatedly upserting different JWKs? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Epoch desync] Can carefully timed PatchUpsertJWK updates cause validators to disagree on JWK state across epochs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [Advanced] [Governance front-running] Can an attacker observe a governance proposal with PatchUpsertJWK and front-run it with a malicious proposal? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [JWK] [Kid collision] Can two different JWKs in PatchUpsertJWK have the same kid (key ID) but different cryptographic material? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [JWK] [Issuer ambiguity] Can visually similar but different issuer strings (e.g., using lookalike Unicode characters) cause issuer confusion? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [JWK] [Key pinning bypass] Can PatchUpsertJWK be used to update pinned keys in a way that bypasses certificate pinning checks? (High)
[File: aptos-core/types/src/jwks/patch/mod.rs] [JWK] [Algorithm confusion] Can a PatchUpsertJWK specify a JWK with algorithm='none' or other weak algorithms? (Critical)
